method: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Add the bacon, garlic and onion and fry for 3-4 minutes, or until the bacon begins to brown and the onion softens. Add the thyme and fry for a further minute. Add the beans and stock to the pan and bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Transfer the soup to a blender or food processor and blend with the parsley and pepper until smooth. Return the soup to the pan and heat through, then ladle into 4 bowls and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 tsp olive oil,  2 lean smoked bacon rashers, chopped,  2 garlic cloves, crushed,  1 onion, chopped,  3 thyme sprigs,  2 x 400g cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed,  850ml/1Â½ pints vegetable stock ,  2 tbsp chopped parsley,  freshly ground black pepper
